name: Mojito
steps: Muddle mint leaves with lime juice and simple syrup|Add rum and stir|Fill glass with crushed ice|Top with soda water|Garnish with mint sprig and lime wheel
notes: Fresh mint is essential for the best flavor. Don't over-muddle the mint or it will become bitter.

name: Margarita
steps: Rim glass with salt|Shake all ingredients with ice|Strain into glass with fresh ice
notes: Use fresh lime juice for best results. Can be served frozen.

name: Gin and Tonic
steps: Fill glass with ice|Add gin|Top with tonic water|Squeeze lime wedge over drink and drop it in|Stir gently
notes: Premium tonic makes a big difference. Try different gin styles for variety.

name: Old Fashioned
steps: Add simple syrup and 3 dashes of bitters to glass|Add whiskey and stir|Add large ice cube|Garnish with orange peel
notes: Express orange oils over the drink before garnishing. Use a quality whiskey. Note: -3 means 3 dashes (count-based)

name: Cosmopolitan
steps: Shake all ingredients with ice|Strain into chilled glass|Garnish with lime wheel
notes: Made famous by Sex and the City. Use quality cranberry juice.

name: Daiquiri
steps: Shake all ingredients with ice|Strain into chilled glass|Garnish with lime wheel
notes: Classic proportions are 8:5:2 (rum:lime:syrup). Adjust to taste.

name: Whiskey Sour
steps: Shake all ingredients with ice|Strain into glass with fresh ice|Garnish with lemon wheel and cherry
notes: Add an egg white for a silkier texture (optional).

name: Mai Tai
ingredients: White Rum;Dark Rum;Triple Sec;Lime Juice;Simple Syrup
steps: Shake all ingredients except dark rum with ice|Strain into glass with crushed ice|Float dark rum on top|Garnish with mint and lime
notes: Authentic Mai Tais don't contain pineapple juice!

name: Negroni
steps: Add all ingredients to mixing glass with ice|Stir for 30 seconds|Strain into glass with fresh ice|Garnish with orange peel
notes: Equal parts recipe. Stir don't shake to maintain clarity.

name: Manhattan
steps: Add all ingredients to mixing glass with ice|Stir for 30 seconds|Strain into chilled glass|Garnish with cherry
notes: Use rye whiskey for a spicier profile. Note: -2 means 2 dashes of bitters (count-based)
